intro: Silene manissadjianii var. straussiana, commonly known as the Strauss's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the eastern Mediterranean. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that disperse its seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
